content:
InputBindingCollection Class

Definition

Represents an ordered collection of InputBinding objects.

In this Article

public sealed class InputBindingCollection : System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
System.Object
InputBindingCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

All objects that derive from UIElement have an InputBindingCollection named InputBindings. All objects that derive from ContentElement have an InputBindingCollection named InputBindings.

However, if these collections are set in XAML, then the items in the collection must be derived classes of InputBinding rather than direct InputBinding objects. This is because InputBinding does not support a default public constructor. Therefore, the items in a InputBindingCollection that was set in XAML will typically be an InputBinding derived class that does support a default public constructor, such as KeyBinding or MouseBinding.

Constructors

InputBindingCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the InputBindingCollection class.

public InputBindingCollection ();

InputBindingCollection(IList)

Initializes a new instance of the InputBindingCollection class using the items in the specified IList.

public InputBindingCollection (System.Collections.IList inputBindings);
inputBindings
IList

The collection whose items are copied to the new InputBindingCollection.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of InputBinding items in this collection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items in the collection.

IsFixedSize

Gets a value that indicates whether this InputBindingCollection has a fixed size.

public bool IsFixedSize { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection has a fixed size; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

An InputBindingCollection is never a fixed size; therefore, IsFixedSize always returns false.

IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether this InputBindingCollection is read-only.

public bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection is read-only; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

An InputBindingCollection is never read-only; therefore, IsReadOnly always returns false.

IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to this InputBindingCollection is synchronized (thread-safe).

public bool IsSynchronized { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection is thread safe; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

SyncRoot can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the InputBinding at the specified index.

public System.Windows.Input.InputBinding this[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The position in the collection.

Value
InputBinding

The InputBinding at the specified index.

SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the InputBindingCollection.

public object SyncRoot { get; }
Value
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the InputBindingCollection.

Methods

Add(InputBinding)

Adds the specified InputBinding to this InputBindingCollection.

public int Add (System.Windows.Input.InputBinding inputBinding);
inputBinding
InputBinding

The binding to add to the collection.

Returns
Int32

Always returns 0. This deviates from the standard IList implementation for Add, which should return the index where the new item was added to the collection.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

inputBinding is null.

AddRange(ICollection)

Adds the items of the specified ICollection to the end of this InputBindingCollection

public void AddRange (System.Collections.ICollection collection);
collection
ICollection

The collection of items to add to the end of this InputBindingCollection.

Clear()

Removes all items from this InputBindingCollection.

public void Clear ();

Contains(InputBinding)

Determines whether the specified InputBinding is in this InputBindingCollection

public bool Contains (System.Windows.Input.InputBinding key);
key
InputBinding

The binding to locate in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified InputBinding is in the collection; otherwise, false.

CopyTo(InputBinding[],Int32)

Copies all of the items in the InputBindingCollection to the specified one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Input.InputBinding[] inputBindings, int index);
inputBindings
InputBinding[]

The array into which the collection is copied.

index
Int32

The index position in inputBindings at which copying starts.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

inputBindings is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than 0.

GetEnumerator()

Gets an enumerator that iterates through this InputBindingCollection.

public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

The enumerator for this collection.

IndexOf(InputBinding)

Searches for the first occurrence of the specified InputBinding in his InputBindingCollection.

public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Input.InputBinding value);
value
InputBinding

The object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of the first occurrence of value, if found; otherwise, –1.

Insert(Int32,InputBinding)

Inserts the specified InputBinding into this InputBindingCollection at the specified index.

public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Input.InputBinding inputBinding);
index
Int32

The zero-based index at which to insert inputBinding.

inputBinding
InputBinding

The binding to insert.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

inputBinding is null.

Remove(InputBinding)

Removes the first occurrence of the specified InputBinding from this InputBindingCollection.

public void Remove (System.Windows.Input.InputBinding inputBinding);
inputBinding
InputBinding

The binding to remove.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the specified InputBinding at the specified index of this InputBindingCollection.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the InputBinding to remove.

Explicit Interface Implementations

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*.

array
Array

A zero-based Array that receives the copied items from the InputBindingCollection.

index
Int32

The first position in the specified Array to receive the copied contents.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the InputBindingCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.
